intro: Salvia euphratica var. euphratica, commonly known as the Euphrates sage, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its gray-green, lance-shaped leaves and striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its aromatic foliage and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to drought-tolerant gardens. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
